Package me.karunarathne

Class PhoneCharging

java.lang.Object
me.karunarathne.PhoneCharging
public class PhoneCharging extends Object
Solution for the Phone Charging problem. This is the only class of the solution package. Only uses static methods.

    • getTime

      public static String getTime(int minutes)

    • timeToCharge

      public static int timeToCharge() throws Exception
      This method handles taking all the console inputs, and passing them over to their relevent methods, for checking and parsing. It does some checks by itself. Uses a try-with-resources block for the java.util.Scanner object. It calls the calculate method with the parsed inputs, and returns the result directly to the caller, total time - as minutes. Throws a generic Exception, if any was propagated.
      Returns:
      timeInMinutes
      Throws:
      Exception

    • calculate

      public static int calculate(float battery, int years, float voltage)
      The number of hours depends on the 3 methods used. Calling each of those methods, and adding up all the minutes (as integer), and returning the result.
      Parameters:
      battery -
      years -
      voltage -
      Returns:
      minutesToCharge

    • takeVoltage

      public static float takeVoltage(String voltageString) throws InputMismatchException
      Using this method to take the voltage as input. It uses two regular expressions, ^(1)\s?(v|V)?\s*$ for 1 V ^(1.5)\s?(v|V)?\s*$ for 1.5 V Returns the float, and if the input does not match either of regular expressions, throws an InputMismatchException .
      Parameters:
      voltageString -
      Returns:
      voltage
      Throws:
      InputMismatchException

    • takeYears

      public static int takeYears(String usedYears) throws InputMismatchException
      This method is used to take the number of years (the phone was used) as input. Supports the word YEARS to be entered in any case (acceptable). Also can take spaces and without spaces, or just the number as the input. Uses the regular expression ^\d{1}( )?(years|Years|year|Year|YEAR)*\s*$ to check all those formats, and picks apart the first character of the input string, cause that would be the number of years. Returns it as int. If the input doesn't match, throws an InputMismatchException .
      Parameters:
      usedYears -
      Returns:
      years
      Throws:
      InputMismatchException

    • takeBattery

      public static float takeBattery(String capacity) throws InputMismatchException
      Checking the taken String input for battery capacity. These three regular expressions will check the string for 1% - 9% ^(\d){1}( )?(%)?(\s)*$ 10% - 99% ^(\d){2}( )?(%)?(\s)*$ 100% ^(100)( )?(%)?(\s)*$ They will also alow multiple formats of input, such as 16 16% 16 % Then this method will slice and cast them into float datatype and returns to the caller. If none of the regular expressions match with the input, we will throw an InputMismatchException .
      Parameters:
      capacity -
      Returns:
      capacityAsFloat
      Throws:
      InputMismatchException
